Hello and welcome to Crusader Mounts. The mod is now setting up and will be ready in one ingame week. If you have either CK2Plus or HIP installed, the mod will autodetect them and make any neccessary adjustments.\nIf you want more info on how some of the mechanics work, please pick the first option to get the info book. Other than console commands, this is your only chance to obtain it.

From here you can access more detailed information on all the mounts of the world, their care, and their uses.
There is a section on the Mount Heartlands as well, and another on Mounted Combat.

This book seems quite rare and is probably the only one in existence.

Mounts are divided into four types: Horses, Camels, Elephants, and Exotic.
Horses are further categorized as Coursers, Destriers, and Chargers.
 Coursers are meant to be fast and light, while Chargers are slow and heavy, and Destriers being in between.
A horse's type can be learned from either it's name, or by it's appearance.

Mounts are mainly obtained from the market decision, with more options appearing if you can reach the required provinces.
There are a couple of unique mounts obtained from various events, as well as decision to ask for a horse from China.
The last method is via breeding more horses yourself.
Mounts can also be sold with a self targeted decision

Each mount has a base health stat, usually five. Some harder to acquire mounts have six or seven.\nEvery two years all mounts have a 60% chance to lose one health. This can be lowered by the following factors: Being unique, having the Robust trait, and the ability of your Stable Master.\n Various events can also modify a mount's health.

Only non-unique horses can breed. As long as you have at least two horses that can breed. Every two years there is a chance they will produce an offspring, fertile horses increase that chance. Each horse can breed twice, fertile horses can breed thrice.\n The horses will pick their mate without human intervention.

The resulting foal's type depends on the first horse's type, as in a Courser will never produce a Destrier or Charger. Then the foal's breed is picked, this depends on both horses' breeds, their origins, and sometimes their owner's culture or location.\nTraits have a chance to be inherited, with much higher chances if both parents have the same trait.\n The foal will age over six years until it is ridable and gains a bonus to it's base health.

The Heartland's resources fluctuate over time. Animals die, craftsmen create more equipment, the area is looted, many things change the area's conditions.\nThe more prosperous the province, as well as the existence of various festivals and craftsmen will increase the Heartland's resources over time.\nOn the other hand, disease, depopulation, sieges, bandits and other nefarious organizations work to harm the resources present.

Combat may occur when a mounted character enters a battle. Chances are increased for warlike characters.\n The tactics available to you depend on your current mount, if you can use horse archery, your opponents mount, and sometimes the terrain.

A wealthy merchant has arrived in your lands claiming to possess the reincarnation of Alexander the Great's own warhorse. After seeing the horse for yourself, you feel inclined to agree. The horse is large and strong, and all attempts to mount him have resulted in failure. The merchant is eager to get rid of him however, as he can't benefit from him.

[From.GetTitledName] has called all worthy men of the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] to attempt to tame a mighty horse. It is said that the horse is the reincarnation of Alexander the Great's own warhorse, Bucephalus. Regardless whether this is true or not, the horse is one of the best in existence.
Let all the worthy men of the realm try to tame him, after I do of course
You arrive at the location where Bucephalus is kept. There is a large crowd gathered, eagerly watching every man's attempt. Finally your turn comes up and you approach the imposing horse.
If he is indeed Alexander's horse, then perhaps I shall mimic Alexander

You climb up the horse and after a few moments of thrashing about he finally calms down. The crowd erupts into cheers celebrating your success. You now have a mighty horse under your command, sure to draw the admiration and envy of all.

Word has reached you that [From.GetTitledName] has successfully tamed Bucephalus. [From.GetSheHeCap] now has a mighty horse under [From.GetHerHis] command, sure to draw the admiration and envy of all.
Bucephalus immediately throws you off. The beast grunts towards you as you back away in shame.

While playing outside you hear the faint sound of animals. As you search for them you remember that [current_guardian.GetFirstName] has some mounts in the stables. Maybe [current_guardian.GetSheHe] might let you see them for a bit?
But what if [current_guardian.GetSheHe] gets mad at me?
One of your [GetFromRelation]s runs up to you all excited. After [From.GetSheHe] calms down a bit [From.GetSheHe] asks if you could show [From.GetHerHim] your mounts in the stables.
[From.GetFirstName] smiles and leads you towards the stables. You were able to see a [random_mount.GetName] while it was eating. After a while you both leave in happiness.
[From.GetFirstName] shoos you away. [From.GetSheHeCap] says that [From.GetSheHe] has no time to entertain children and that you should go bother someone else.

While you huddle in the safety of your castle, you remember the animals stuck in the stables. The epidemic will surely affect them if you do nothing. You could bring a couple of them inside the castle, but risk infection.
Get them here before they die!
Our lives are much more valuable

In the late hours of the night as you sit secluded in your prayers, you hear a commotion coming from outside. You leave castle and wander around outside, noting that for some reason nobody is around, not even the guards.\nFinally you find the source, it's coming from the stables.\nWhen you enter you see a strange sight, a horse that was never there before. It's a beautiful white arabian horse, but what's stranger is that you feel a soothing sense of peace whenever you look at it. One thing is certain, this horse is not of this world.

A group of craftsmen have arrived in your lands seeking fortune. They are quite skilled, especially in the creation of mount equipment but require some funds in order to get the tools they need. Sponsoring them would bring mutual benefits.

The current group of doctors from the Hospital of [From.GetName] have proven themselves extremely skilled and efficient. There are barely any sick patients left, allowing them to instead tend to the traders passing through the province.

The local traders have come to see you with an offer. If you would lend them some of your personal land for them to graze the horses, they would give you a small cut of their profits from their future sales.

As you look upon your lands, you think up of various methods to increase it's overall wealth. Since [Root.GetName] is considered a Mount Heartlands, perhaps you could take advantage of that. Nothing says fun like horse races. If you organized some you could draw more foreign traders to your lands.
It has come to your attention that you have run out of food for your [random_mount.GetName]. This could be a chance for you to improve your [random_mount.GetMountType]'s health.
Don't bother me with such trifles, anything is fine

After taking a look for yourself, it's clear that it's all from [stable_master.GetFirstName]'s tireless efforts. Surely he deserves a reward.

You take a peak outside and see both [stable_master.GetFirstName] and [stable_master_arguement_courtier.GetBestName] in a heated arguement. The two are almost at each other's throats, and not to mention disturbing their [Root.GetTitle].
